Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2009 08:50PM ShondaE wrote: I've been away for a while.  I hope everybody's treatment is going well.  I have had 2 treatments and just have absolutly no energy.  I don't even want to get out of bed most of the time.  All in all my treatments are going well, the SE's are kicking my but but i am sure glad to be halfway done. It looks like I have alot of reading to catch up on. Hugs Shonda
Posts.Title: **NEW** Starting Chemo March 2009 ginagina celia088

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2008 09:27PM ShondaE wrote: I had my first treatment of A/C on 11-25-08, I work pt as a CSA for an airline, they have been very supportive and understand what is going on I did go back to work on Sunday and Monday of this week and was totally exhausted by the time I got home.  But it was nice to get out of the house and start to think about something besides treatment.  I am hoping to contiue to work thu out my treatment.  Shonda
Posts.Title: Working During Chemo zuffa kjbell

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2009 04:52PM ShondaE wrote: I had my surgery on the 10th and am hoping to get my drains out tomorrow. I was in the hospital for 3 days because of having Bi-Lat and ovaries removed at the same time.  No reconstruction yet. My left are where they took 3 lymphnodes out (which were clean)YEAH..still hurts like crazy.  DH has been such a great support and never left the hospital while i was there.  He went back to work yesterday and only worked half a day becasue he dosen't  want me home alone all day yet. I fainted on him on Sunday when he was changing my drains.  I was sitting in a chair and next thing I Knew I was waking up on the floor sobbing hysterically...It's funny now but wasn't so funny when it first happened. I've been doing alot of sleeping, i can't seem to make it thru the day without several naps.  Hopefully that will go away soon. I hope everybody that has already had surgery is doing well, I need to read and catch up on how everybody is doing.  Everybody still going for surgery this month I will continue to send prayers and good thoughts your way.  Shonda
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2009 10:00PM - edited Jan 30, 2009 10:10PM by ShondaE It looks like I am going to join the February surgery group.  I am scheduled for a Bi-lateral MX with my ovaries removed as well on the 10th of Feb..I have to be at the hospital at 6:00 in the morning..YUCK..lol...My prayers and positive thoughts go out to all going thru this.  Shonda

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2009 04:13PM ShondaE wrote: Rest in Peace, Stephanie.. To Stephanie's family you are in my thoughts and prayers. Shonda
Posts.Title: Stephanie is an Angel 2timer Britt

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2008 11:11AM ShondaE wrote: I am starting Chemo tomorrow.  A/C every 2 weeks for 8 weeks, followed by lumpectomy more chemo and then rads.  I was supposed to get my port put in today but they never called to schedule the appt, so they said they will use my arm for tomorrow's chemo.  I'm nervous and scared thankfully my husband is a great support for me.  My daughters are 17 & 16, they are doing pretty good with my diagnosis, but scared becasue we lost my mom 4yrs ago to BC.  I went wig shopping on saturday and found 2 that look almost identical to the color and style my hair already is. My boxing gloves are on and i'm ready to fight this.  This site has been such a great source of information and encouragment.  I wish everybody the best Shonda
Posts.Title: Has anyone started a forum for Chemo in Dec 2008? horsercn Texas357

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2008 10:21PM ShondaE wrote: I had my first A/C treatment on the 25th, and slept most of the next three days thanks to the nausea meds, I am starting to finally not feel nauseated all the time.  Yeah just in time for tx #2 on Tuesday.  I did manage to go into work on Sunday and Monday of this week so that was nice to just get out of the house and focus on something besides treatment. I saw my Onco today for a 1 week follow-up after chemo and she said she can already feel a reduction in the tumor in my breast after one treatment, Man i was very happy to hear that, funny enough I have been afraid to touch the area that the tumor is on since I started all of this, I guess I didn't want to feel if it was getting any bigger. I'm glad to see everybody is doing pretty good with your treatments,  I will send positive thoughts and prayers your way. Shonda
Posts.Title: Has anyone started a forum for Chemo in Dec 2008? horsercn Texas357

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 08:00PM ShondaE wrote: I always had a soft blanket to cover up with and my phone that is loaded with music and ear phones..i slept thru most of my treatments...I always wore a skirt and loose fitting shirt expecially around the chest area so my port could be accessed.
Posts.Title: What do you pack for Chemo? BShoemaker Moderators

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 10:42PM ShondaE wrote: I had the first surgeon I saw tell me "Well I don't have breasts so I can't tell you what to do".we were talking about wether or not I should do Mastectomy or Lumpectomy...I was so shocked, but I think he was even more shocked when I said "Well I don't have a dick either but I am sure I would be able to tell you the pros and cons of getting it cut off or having a lump removed..." To say the least I left his office and found another Surgeon
Posts.Title: 100 things never to say to a woman who has had a mastectomy: iwannabefree jillyG

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 08:52PM ShondaE wrote: #68-Well at least you got the best cancer to have, since all they have to do is remove your breasts.. I looked at her and said "would you like me to lift up my shirt and show you how "curable it is"...said by a woman at the bingo hall.
